info.title: Entegrations.io
info.description: Entegrations.io, inc provides 3 broad set of features. 1) PayPal Invoicing, Payouts and IPN features leveraging your PayPal account. 2) Webhooks for Invoicing and Contacts leveraging your Xero account. 3) QBO Inovice leveraging your QuickBooks Online account.

post.description: Create a draft PayPal Invoice and immediately sends it to a receiver as per their APIs https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/invoicing/v1/#invoices_create and https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/invoicing/v1/#invoices_send
Create PayPal Payouts to one or more receivers as per their API https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/payments.payouts-batch/v1/#payouts_create

x-ms-notification-content.description: Advanced Use: Details for Entegrations.io Invoicing or Payouts Webhook data for PayPal
x-ms-notification-content.summary: Advanced Use: Details for Entegrations.io Invoicing or Payouts Webhook data for PayPal

post.summary: Advanced Use: When invoicing, payouts updates received
post.description: Advanced Use: Creates an entegrations.io webhook for PayPal Invoicing, Payouts etc webhooks data and it triggers whenever entegrations.io receives an on-behalf-of webhook payload from PayPal. Note that this is default payload, getting you whatever PayPal sends out.

parameters.name: Request body of the webhook
parameters.description: This is the request body of the Webhook

post.summary: Advanced Use: When an IPN (generic) update is received
post.description: Advanced Use: Creates an entegrations.io webhook for PayPal IPN event data and it triggers whenever entegrations.io receives an on-behalf-of IPN payload from PayPal. Note that this is default payload, getting you whatever PayPal sends out.

parameters.name: txnType
parameters.description: txn_type of the IPN being created. Leave all for all txn_types.
parameters.x-ms-summary: txn_type of the IPN being created.

parameters.name: txnStatus
parameters.description: txn or payment status of the Webhook being created. Leave all for all statuses.
parameters.x-ms-summary: txn or payment status of the Webhook being created.

parameters.name: Request body of the webhook
parameters.description: This is the request body of the Webhook

post.description: Create and sends and a QuickBooks Online Invoice as per their API https://developer.intuit.com/app/developer/qbo/docs/api/accounting/ecommerce/invoice

email.description: Sender's email which corresponds to PayPal account.
email.title: Sender's email

national_number.title: Sender's phone number with area code

email.description: Bill to email. This may be an email of reciever's PayPal account.
email.title: Bill to email

note.title: Invoice note
note.example: Thank you for your TEST business.

status.description: Status of creating the Invoice. Possible values: success or error.

errorMessage.description: Error message, if there is any error.
errorMessage.example: Internal server error performing the request.

email.description: Sender's email which corresponds to PayPal account.
email.title: Sender's email

merchant_info.description: Sender's email information. PayPal api won't require this but as an extra security check entegrations.io would require it.

sender_batch_id.description: Sender's Batch ID (Should be unique value, in last 30 days, per PayPal).
sender_batch_id.title: Sender's Batch ID

email_subject.description: Subject of the email notification that would be sent out by PayPal.
email_subject.title: Email Subject

recipient_type.description: Recipient type. Valid values are either of EMAIL /  PAYER_ID / PHONE. Either this value or the ones in Payout item/details is mandatory.
recipient_type.title: Receiver Type

recipient_type.description: Recipient type. Valid values are either of EMAIL /  PAYER_ID / PHONE. Either this value or the one in Payout batch header is mandatory.
recipient_type.title: Receiver Type

receiver.description: Receiver's email / PayPal payer_id / phone number.
receiver.title: Receiver (email / payer id / phone)

note.title: Note
note.example: This is note of the test Payout.

sender_item_id.description: Sender's Payout Item ID (Should be unique value, in last 30 days, per PayPal).
sender_item_id.title: Sender's Item ID

status.description: Status of creating the Payouts. Possible values: success or error.

paypal_payout_batch_id.description: Batch ID generated by the PayPal for this Payout.

sender_batch_id.description: Batch ID that was sent in the request (echoing back the same value)

errorMessage.description: Error message, if there is any error.
errorMessage.example: Internal server error performing the request.

paypalEmailAddress.description: Email address of the PayPal account. You must use the same PayPal email address you have used to on-board for the connector.
Email address of the PayPal account. You must use the same PayPal email address you have used to on-board for the connector.
Email address of the PayPal account. You must use the same PayPal email address you have used to on-board for the connector.
Email address of the PayPal account. You must use the same PayPal email address you have used to on-board for the connector.
Email address of the PayPal account. You must use the same PayPal email address you have used to on-board for the connector.
Email address of the PayPal account. You must use the same PayPal email address you have used to on-board for the connector.
Email address of the PayPal account. You must use the same PayPal email address you have used to on-board for the connector.

resource_json_stringified.x-ms-summary: Stringified version of the resource given by PayPal

custom.x-ms-summary: custom value (that you must have used during your integration with PayPal and that's) as given by PayPal

payer_full_name.x-ms-summary: first and last name, if they are null. Otherwise, the business name. These values are as given by PayPal

xeroEmailAddress.description: Email address of the Xero account. You must use the same Xero email address you have used to onboard for the custom connector.
Email address of the Xero account. You must use the same Xero email address you have used to onboard for the custom connector.

shouldGetInvoiceAsPdf.description: Indicate if invoice has also to be gotten as PDF from Xero in addition to invoice resource.

xeroEmailAddress.description: Email address of the Xero account. You must use the same Xero email address you have used to onboard for the custom connector.

SenderEmail.description: Sender's email which corresponds to Intuit QuickBooks Online account.
SenderEmail.title: Sender's email

RealmId.description: Sender's Realm ID or Company ID which corresponds to Intuit QuickBooks Online account.
RealmId.title: Sender's Realm ID or Company ID

event_date_tc.x-ms-summary: eventDateUtc as given by Xero, for e.g. 2017-06-21T01:15:39.902

event_type.x-ms-summary: eventType as given by Xero. Can be Create or Update

event_category.x-ms-summary: eventCategory as given by Xero. Can be INVOICE or CONTACT, but INVOICE for this scenario.

tenant_id.x-ms-summary: tenantId as given by Xero, for e.g. c2cc9b6e-9458-4c7d-93cc-f02b81b0594f

tenantType.x-ms-summary: tenantType as given by Xero, which is ORGANISATION for now

invoice_resource.x-ms-summary: Invoice resource as given by Xero.

invoice_pdf_as_base64.x-ms-summary: When fetching this invoice as PDF, this optional field can contain Base64 version of application/pdf content given by Xero.

event_date_tc.x-ms-summary: eventDateUtc as given by Xero, for e.g. 2017-06-21T01:15:39.902

event_type.x-ms-summary: eventType as given by Xero. Can be Create or Update

event_category.x-ms-summary: eventCategory as given by Xero. Can be INVOICE or CONTACT, but CONTACT for this scenario.

tenant_id.x-ms-summary: tenantId as given by Xero, for e.g. c2cc9b6e-9458-4c7d-93cc-f02b81b0594f

tenantType.x-ms-summary: tenantType as given by Xero, which is ORGANISATION for now

contact_resource.x-ms-summary: contact resource as given by Xero

status.description: Status of creating the Invoice. Possible values: success or error.

errorMessage.description: Error message, if there is any error.
errorMessage.example: Internal server error performing the request.
